meanings.definition: To fall down or inward suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The old building was collapsing under its own weight.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was collapsing due to the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The collapsing cake made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes were collapsing like a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The collapsing sandcastle was a sad sight on the beach.

meanings.definition: To break down or fail suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The company was collapsing after the financial crisis.
meanings.sent2: His plan was collapsing before his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The collapsing computer system caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was collapsing like a crumbling wall.
meanings.sent5: The collapsing market left many investors in despair.

meanings.definition: To fold or shrink in upon itself.
meanings.sent1: The umbrella was collapsing as she closed it.
meanings.sent2: The telescope was collapsing for easy storage.
meanings.sent3: The collapsing map confused the hikers on the trail.
meanings.sent4: His dream of becoming an artist was collapsing like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The collapsing tent made it challenging to sleep outdoors.
